value.title: Conversational AI: Inside Rasa's open source approach
value.excerpt: Rasa isn't the only open source approach to natural language processing, but its large community suggests it's doing something right.

value.title: An AI Used Facebook Data to Predict Mental Illness
value.excerpt: Volunteers let an AI scan their messages from more than a year before they received a psychiatric diagnosis. It was able to flag signs of their conditions.

value.title: Robots can encourage people to take greater risks, research shows
value.excerpt: New research has shown robots can encourage people to take greater risks in a simulated gambling scenario than they would if there was nothing to influence their behaviors.

value.title: What Big Tech and Big Tobacco research funding have in common
value.excerpt: Attendees of the Resistance AI workshop at NeurIPS say that by funding research, Big Tech is following the same playbook as Big Tobacco.

value.title: New Project Will Give U.S. MQ-9 Reaper Drones Artificial Intelligence
value.excerpt: The Pentagon’s Joint Artificial Intelligence Center has awarded a $93.3 million contract to General Atomics Aeronautical Systems, Inc to equip their drone with new AI technology for smart, autonomous operations.

value.title: Tesla expands in-house Self-Driving testing to Phoenix
value.excerpt: Driving testing to Phoenix, Arizona, which is already a hub for self-driving tests. Over the last few years, Tesla has been criticized for not reporting autonomous test mileage in California. The California DMV makes companies who are testing autonomous vehicles in the state submit yearly “disengagement reports”

value.title: Privacy advocates poop on UK supermarket’s facial recognition system
value.excerpt: The Southern Co-op supermarket's use of facial recognition to reduce crime has sparked concerns that it could wrongly flag innocent people as criminals.

value.title: Bringing data back to the future: Forecasting supply chains with savvy data usage, deep learning, and more
value.excerpt: Historical insights are routinely deployed to determine market forecasts, but how does one predict shifts in consumer behavior related to an unprecedented modern plague? The answer: Clever data use.

value.title: Teachable AI will help Alexa users set up preferences
value.excerpt: Amazon says that in the coming months, Alexa customers will be able to 'teach' the virtual assistant their preferences.

value.title: Facial recognition's fate could be decided in 2021
value.excerpt: A number of lawsuits and legislative measures mean the debate over the use of facial recognition is poised to ramp up.

value.title: How AI Can Help Surmount BI Shortcomings
value.excerpt: If business leaders can reconfigure their thinking about BI and AI tools so that BI, AI and human employees can do what they are best at, enterprises can become far more efficient and innovate at much faster speeds than ever before.

value.title: Hyundai Motor Buys 80% of Robotics Firm Boston Dynamics
value.excerpt: Hyundai Motor Group agreed to buy a controlling stake in Boston Dynamics Inc. in a deal that values the mobile robot firm at $1.1 billion.

value.title: Identifying training bottlenecks and system resource under-utilization with Amazon SageMaker Debugger
value.excerpt: At AWS re:Invent 2020, AWS released the profiling functionality for Amazon SageMaker Debugger. In this post, we expand on the importance of profiling deep neural network (DNN) training, review some of the common performance bottlenecks you might encounter, and demonstrate how to use the profiling feature

value.title: New York City Council votes to prohibit businesses from using facial recognition without public notice
value.excerpt: New York City Council today passed a sweeping privacy law for commercial establishments that prohibits retailers and other businesses from using facial recognition or other biometric tracking without notice.

value.title: Study details first artificial intelligence tool to help labs rule-out COVID-19
value.excerpt: Hospital-based laboratories and doctors at the front line of the COVID-19 pandemic might soon add artificial intelligence to their testing toolkit. A recent study conducted with collaborators from the University of Vermont and Cedars-Sinai describes the performance of Biocogniv's new AI-COVID software.

value.title: Watson Assistant improves intent detection accuracy, leads against AI vendors cited in published study
value.excerpt: Have you ever used a chatbot to get help? If you have, chances are that you’re all too familiar with answers like, “I’m sorry, I don’t understand” or “Can you try rephrasing?” With frustrating responses like these, many businesses still see chatbots as immature tools for customer service.
